Container.Name: qbittorrentvpn
Container.Overview:
Docker container which runs a headless qBittorrent client with WebUI while connecting to OpenVPN. Includes iptables to prevent IP leakage when tunnel does down.
### Environmental Variables | Variable | Required | Function | |`VPN_ENABLED` | Yes | Enable VPN? (yes|no) Default:yes | |`LAN_NETWORK` | Yes | Local Network with CIDR notation | |`NAME_SERVERS` | No | Comma delimited name servers | |`PUID` | No | UID applied to config files and downloads | |`PGID` | No | GID applied to config files and downloads |
### Volumes | Variable | Required | Function | | `config` | Yes | qBittorrent and OpenVPN config files | | `downloads` | No | Default download path for torrents |
### Ports | Port | Required | Function | | `8080` | Yes | qBittorrent WebUI | | `8999` | Yes | Listening port for qBittorrent (TCP) | | `8999` | Yes | Listening port for qBittorrent (UDP) |
## Web UI: Access the Web UI by browsing to http://IPADDRESS:8080 in a browser on the same network.
Note: qBittorrent throws a "Referer header & Target origin mismatch!" when trying to open with the WebUI menu link. Instead browse to the containers IP and Port with a web browser on the same network and it will work. Or copy the address bar in the new tab when opening with the WebUI menu link, paste it in a new tab/windows address bar and press enter.
## Default Credentials | Credential | Default Value | |`WebUI Username`| admin | |`WebUI Password` | adminadmin |
## How to use OpenVPN The container will fail to boot if `VPN_ENABLED` is set to yes or empty and a .ovpn is not present in the /config/openvpn directory. Drop a .ovpn file from your VPN provider into /config/openvpn and start the container again. You may need to edit the ovpn configuration file to load your VPN credentials from a file by setting `auth-user-pass`.
### Example auth-user-pass option `auth-user-pass credentials.conf`
### Example credentials.conf username password
